pullRequest.title: DPC-936: Add MBIs to sample beneficiaries
pullRequest.bodyText:
Why
As we get ready to roll out MBI support, we need to update our test data to include the new identifiers.
What Changed
Added a script to automatically update patient bundles with MBIs, from the sample CSV file provided by the BFD team.
Committed the MBI hash CSV to the repo, as we may find uses for it in the future.
Choices Made
Added both the hashed and un-hashed MBI value to the patient records, it may not be necessary to include the hashed value, it it's possible it would help improve data loading time in the future.
Tickets closed:
DPC-936
Future Work
All the other MBI work to come.
Checklist

 All tests are passing via make ci-app (app change) and make ci-web (website change)
 Swagger documentation has been updated
 FHIR documentation has been updated
 Any required dpc-ops changes have a PR submitted and mentioned in this ticket
 Any manual migration steps are documented, scripts written (where applicable), and tested
 Before merging, any required dpc-ops changes have been approved and merged into master of the dpc-ops repo

nodes.bodyText: I gather the purpose of this file is to do a one-time fixup of the json files that are checked into the project. It is not a test. Right? Suggest a comment to that fact.

commit.message:
DPC-936: Add MBIs to sample beneficiaries

Added a script to automatically update patient bundles with MBIs.
Committed the mbi hash csv to the repo, we may find uses for it in the future.

DPC-936: Add comments to scripts about them not being tests.

Added a comment to each of the script classes to make it clear they're not part of the actual release testing process.

afterCommit.message:
DPC-936: Add comments to scripts about them not being tests.

Added a comment to each of the script classes to make it clear they're not part of the actual release testing process.
